attributes.title: Fall in love with seeking
attributes.description:
In today’s (09th October, 2015) Nithya Satsang, Paramahamsa Nithyananda enters into the 15th verse of Isavasya Upanishad, which describes the necessity and the power of seeking. Expanding on seeking, he reveals that seeking is not what we call 'religion' or 'spirituality. "Seeking is your innermost core pain, by understanding, it has not yet expressed it’s full potential, your innermost ghost suffocation by understanding it needs to expand, your innermost being’s decision to expand and not continue with the status quo." When we seek the higher possibilities, our mind, body, intellect and bio-memory gets recognised and rejuvenated. The moment seeking starts, you wake up to Cosmos! How every day morning you wake up to this world, same way when the seeking starts, you wake up to the Cosmos, the higher energies. 
hiraṇmayena pātreṇa satyasyāpihitaṁ mukhaṁ |
tat tvaṁ pūṣann-apāvṛṇu satya-dharmāya dṛṣṭaye || 15 ||
